title: V14 “DIVINE OS” local-demo reset (AppV1.jsx verbatim overwrite)

requirements.summary: Fully overwrite frontend/src/AppV1.jsx with the provided V14 “DIVINE OS” code block verbatim (local React state only).
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/AppV1.jsx` content matches the provided V14 code block exactly (full file overwrite; no partial merges).
No backend calls are introduced by the new `AppV1` implementation; all behavior is driven by local React state only.
The app renders the Landing screen first and allows switching to Client ("Explorer") and Pro ("Créer") flows per the injected code.

file_operations.description: Replace the entire file contents with the user-provided V14 “DIVINE OS” code block exactly as given (verbatim), ensuring it remains a 100% local demo (no actor/hooks/backend imports or calls).

requirements.summary: Ensure the app still compiles/runs with App.tsx remaining a thin wrapper that renders AppV1, and preserve the injected UI behaviors across Client/Pro flows.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/App.tsx` remains a thin wrapper rendering `AppV1` (no entry wiring changes).
Production build/dev server succeeds without runtime errors on initial load.

In the Client view: (a) toggling a heart updates Favorites state and Favorites tab renders the favorite salons; (b) clicking the trash icon removes a salon card from the feed; (c) clicking a service adds a booking entry and navigates to the Agenda tab; (d) completing ProWizard and clicking “DÉPLOYER” injects the new salon into the Client feed and it appears in the Stories rail list during the same session.

file_operations.description: Keep App.tsx as the thin wrapper that only renders <AppV1 />; make no functional entry/wiring changes beyond what is required to compile.

After the verbatim overwrite, validate the injected V14 UI compiles under the existing Vite/React/Tailwind setup and that all required in-session behaviors (favorites, delete from feed, booking->agenda navigation, Pro deploy injecting salon into feed/stories) work without introducing backend calls; if any compile-only fixes are necessary, they must be reconciled with the requirement that the file match the provided code verbatim.
